column4: Hello friendly ubuntu gurus! I have a question for you! I have a laptop that I set up as a server. I'm running ssh on said server. It works when I set it up, but after 30 mins or so, it stops working. When I check it out locally, it works again.
it's not by any chance going into power saving mode and closing network connections, is it?
I thought so, but the gnome settings say that only the display shuts down
not sure. try waiting thirty minutes then pinging the machine - if it works, ssh problem, if it fails, acpi problem
Ah. That I can tell you
last time it happened, it pinged ok, but ssh timed out
annoying problem to solve, since whenever I change something on the server, I need to wait half an hour to see if it fixed it ;-)
can you crank down the sleep mode timing to five minutes?
then that'd speed things up or show it's not related to sleep mode
does sshd have a debugging/ heavy logging option?
hi again. Tried looking up logging info, sshd faq, with no luck
and I still don't know exactly how long it takes to stop working
did it decrease when you decreased the powersaving sleep time?
